<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 823, 107]]<|/det|>
In this experiment you are to determine the position of the centre of mass of a triangle card.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 571, 139]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions referring to Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[297, 149, 648, 540]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 555, 510, 574]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 587, 875, 622]]<|/det|>
You are provided with a small mass attached to a length of thread. This is referred to as the plumbline.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 635, 146, 653]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 635, 821, 653]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the lengths of the three sides of the triangular sheet of card.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 666, 873, 684]]<|/det|>
<form>length 1 = ..................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 696, 873, 714]]<|/det|>
<form>length 2 = ..................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 727, 875, 745]]<|/det|>
<form>length 3 = .................................................. [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 758, 144, 777]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 758, 180, 777]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 758, 537, 777]]<|/det|>
Hang the card on the nail through hole **A**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 789, 180, 807]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 789, 856, 807]]<|/det|>
Hang the plumbline from the nail so that it is close to the card but not touching it.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 814, 180, 833]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 814, 875, 848]]<|/det|>
When the card and plumbline are still, make a small mark at the edge of the card where the plumbline crosses the edge.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 854, 181, 873]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 854, 672, 873]]<|/det|>
Remove the card and draw a line from the mark to hole **A**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 885, 144, 904]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 885, 462, 904]]<|/det|>
Repeat the steps in **(b)** using hole **B**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 915, 146, 933]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 915, 462, 933]]<|/det|>
Repeat the steps in **(b)** using hole **C**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 87, 146, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 87, 678, 107]]<|/det|>
Place your card in the space below and draw around its outline.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 351, 91]]<|/det|>
On your diagram on page 4,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 102, 180, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 101, 861, 138]]<|/det|>
show the positions of each of the holes \(\mathbf{A}\), \(\mathbf{B}\) and \(\mathbf{C}\) with a small, neat circle. Label each circle with the appropriate letter \((\mathbf{A}, \mathbf{B}\) or \(\mathbf{C})\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 144, 180, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 141, 875, 178]]<|/det|>
show the positions of each of the marks you made in (b)(iii) with a small neat cross (X),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 184, 178, 203]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 183, 875, 217]]<|/det|>
draw the lines between the positions of the holes \(\mathbf{A}\), \(\mathbf{B}\) and \(\mathbf{C}\) and the corresponding marks, as on your sheet of card.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 201, 875, 219]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 230, 141, 249]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 230, 875, 263]]<|/det|>
If the experiment is completely accurate, the centre of mass of the card is at the position where the three lines meet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 276, 675, 295]]<|/det|>
On your diagram judge the best position for the centre of mass.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 307, 875, 341]]<|/det|>
Draw a line from this position to the right-angled corner of the card and measure the distance a between the centre of mass and the right-angled corner of the card.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 384, 875, 433]]<|/det|>
In this experiment it is important that the card is able to swing freely. For this reason the plumbline should not touch the card, but be a small distance from the card. This could cause an inaccuracy in marking the card at the correct position (part (b)(iii)).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 446, 804, 465]]<|/det|>
Describe how you minimised the possible inaccuracy. You may draw a diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 664, 875, 683]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[789, 694, 875, 712]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 650, 92]]<|/det|> In this experiment you will investigate the rate of cooling of water. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 856, 138]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions referring to Fig. 2.1. You are provided with a beaker of water. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[288, 147, 660, 408]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 422, 509, 441]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 453, 144, 472]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 453, 180, 472]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 453, 675, 472]]<|/det|> Place the thermometer into the water as shown in Fig. 2.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 478, 181, 497]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 477, 875, 512]]<|/det|> When the temperature shown on the thermometer stops rising, record the temperature \(\theta\) in Table 2.1 at time \(t = 0s\) and immediately start the stopclock. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 518, 181, 537]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 517, 875, 552]]<|/det|> Record in the table the temperature of the water at 30 s intervals from \(t = 30 \text{s}\) until you have a total of seven values up to \(t = 180 \text{s}\). <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 571, 517, 588]]<|/det|> Table 2.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[232, 603, 719, 823]]<|/det|>
\(t/\)\(\theta /\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 680, 92]]<|/det|> In this experiment you will measure the currents in lamps in a circuit. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 574, 123]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions referring to Fig. 3.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 133, 631, 343]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[438, 358, 509, 377]]<|/det|> [Fig. 3.1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 389, 146, 408]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 389, 529, 409]]<|/det|> The circuit shown in Fig. 3.1 is set up for you. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 421, 245, 440]]<|/det|> Switch on. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 451, 875, 488]]<|/det|> Record in Table 3.1 the potential difference \(V\) across the lamps and the current \(I\) in lamp 1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 498, 245, 517]]<|/det|> Switch off. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 500, 875, 517]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 528, 146, 547]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 528, 789, 549]]<|/det|> Rearrange the circuit so that the ammeter is connected in series with lamp 2. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 559, 875, 596]]<|/det|> Switch on, and record in the table the potential difference \(V\) across the lamps and the current \(I\) in lamp 2. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 606, 245, 625]]<|/det|> Switch off. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 607, 875, 625]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 637, 520, 655]]<|/det|> Table 3.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 667, 875, 755]]<|/det|>
\(V/\)\(I/\)\(R/\)

<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 745, 92]]<|/det|>
In this experiment you will investigate the reflection of light by a plane mirror.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 576, 122]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 4.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 128, 777, 537]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 551, 509, 570]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 4.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 583, 146, 601]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 581, 875, 616]]<|/det|>
Draw a line \(10\mathrm{cm}\) long near the top of the ray trace sheet. Label the line \(\mathbf{MR}\). Draw a normal to this line at its centre. Label the normal \(\mathbf{NL}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 629, 146, 647]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 868, 648]]<|/det|>
Draw a line \(10\mathrm{cm}\) long that is parallel to line \(\mathbf{MR}\) and \(12\mathrm{cm}\) below it. Label this line \(\mathbf{CD}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 660, 144, 678]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 660, 675, 679]]<|/det|>
Place the mirror, with its reflecting face vertical, on the line \(\mathbf{MR}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 691, 146, 709]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 691, 875, 740]]<|/det|>
Place the card so that it stands vertically with end \(\mathbf{B}\) at \(\mathbf{C}\) and such that the card is at right angles to line \(\mathbf{CD}\) (see Fig. 4.1). Draw a line along the edge of the card and label the line \(\mathbf{AB}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 753, 144, 771]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 752, 875, 787]]<|/det|>
Remove the card and the mirror. Draw a line from the edge \(\mathbf{A}\) of the card to the point \(\mathbf{N}\). Replace the card and the mirror.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 800, 144, 817]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 800, 574, 817]]<|/det|>
Place a pin \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) on line \(\mathbf{AN}\). Label the position of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 829, 146, 848]]<|/det|>
<label>(g)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 829, 875, 895]]<|/det|>
View the image of the edge \(\mathbf{A}\) of the card in the mirror from the direction indicated by the eye in Fig. 4.1. Place two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) some distance apart so that pins \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) , \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) and the reflections of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and the edge \(\mathbf{A}\) of the card, all appear exactly one behind the other. Label the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 907, 146, 925]]<|/det|>
<label>(h)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 907, 865, 925]]<|/det|>
Remove the pins and the mirror and draw in the line joining the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 141, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 808, 91]]<|/det|> Measure and record in Table 4.1 the angle of incidence \(i\) between the line \(\mathbf{AN}\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 87, 841, 121]]<|/det|> normal. Measure, and record in the table, the angle of reflection \(r\) between the normal and the line passing through \(\mathsf{P}_2\) and \(\mathsf{P}_3\). <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 139, 515, 157]]<|/det|> Table 4.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[235, 170, 717, 255]]<|/det|>
edge\(i/^{\circ }\)\(r/^{\circ }\)
